description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, National institutions and local authorities enable the population, especially the most vulnerable, to exercise their rights with regard to health, nutrition, and access to water and sanitation, in order to realise the democratic dividend and achieve the SDGs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: UNICEF successfully advocated globally for the rights of children in Madagascar through various media channels including social media, events/ceremonies, and digital productions. UNICEF actively engaged with international media such as the Economist, the BBC, and RFI to raise public and donor awareness of the L2 emergency in southern Madagascar and UNICEF’s response. Young people were encouraged to be agents of change and Madagascar has one of the most active youth participation programmes in ESA region. UNICEF organised training sessions for young people, and translated the youth advocacy guide into Malagasy – the first country to do so. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
